name.text: 12.1.3.3 The tangent line to a curve: sinusoid

questiontext.text:
Exercise

In this exercise we will approximate the equation of the tangent line to the curve \(y = {@y1@}\) at the point \(x = \displaystyle {@p1@}\) and find where this line intersects the \(x\)-axis. Note that the following figure is for illustration only and the gradient can be either positive or negative:

  1. We first specify \(x_0\) and \(f(x_0)\) from the information above:

    \(x_0 =\) [[input:ans6]] [[validation:ans6]][[feedback:prt6]]

    \(f(x_0) =\) [[input:ans7]] [[validation:ans7]][[feedback:prt7]]

  2. We now obtain the values of the slope of the tangent at \(x_0\), i.e., \(m=\dfrac{df}{dx}\bigg|_{x_0}\) and the \(y\)-intercept \(f(x_0) - mx_0\). Give your answers correct to \(2\) decimal places

    \(\dfrac{df}{dx}\bigg|_{x_0}=\)[[input:ans8]] [[validation:ans8]][[feedback:prt8]]

    \(f(x_0) - mx_0=\) [[input:ans9]] [[validation:ans9]][[feedback:prt9]]

  3. Use these approximate values to obtain an equation approximating the tangent line:

    \(y=\) [[input:ans10]] [[validation:ans10]][[feedback:prt10]]

  4. Where does this line intersect the \(x\)-axis?

    \(x=\) [[input:ans11]] [[validation:ans11]][[feedback:prt11]]

generalfeedback.text:
We are asked to find the equation of the tangent line to the curve \(y = {@y1@}\) at the point \(x = \displaystyle {@p1@}.\)

  1. First we specify that

    \(\displaystyle x_0 = {@ta6@}\) and \(\displaystyle f(x_0) = {@ta7@}.\)

  2. Then we obtain the values of \(\dfrac{df}{ dx} \bigg|_{ x_0}\) and \(f(x_0) - mx_0\). We have \(\dfrac{df}{dx} = {@b@}\cos({@b@}x)\), and therefore \[\frac{df}{dx} \bigg|_{@p1@} = {@b@}\cos\left({@b*p1@}\right) = {@m_val@}={@ta8@} ,\] and

    \(\displaystyle f\left({@p1@}\right) - \left({@m_val@}\right) \cdot {@p1@} = {@ta9@} \) to 2 d.p.

  3. Hence we obtain the equation of the tangent line:

    \(\displaystyle y = {@ta8@}x + {@ta9@}\) to 2 d.p.

  4. When \(y = 0\), we have

    \({@ta8@}x + {@ta9@} = 0\) and then \(x = {@ta11@}\) to 2 d.p.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
